title: Risk Analyst
description:
**JOB SUMMARY**



B-Stock is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our dynamic Risk Management Department as a Risk Analyst. As a Risk Analyst, you will play a crucial role in identifying, assessing, mitigating, and monitoring risks that could impact the organization's operations and reputation. Your responsibilities will encompass various aspects of risk management, including but not limited to risk identification, assessment, mitigation, compliance management, crisis response, and continuous improvement.

  


**ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Risk Identification & Assessment:
	+ Conduct comprehensive assessments to identify potential risks to the organization.
	+ Evaluate internal and external factors contributing to uncertainties and adverse events.
	+ Assess the likelihood and potential impact of identified risks.
	+ Prioritize risks based on severity and likelihood to guide resource allocation.
* Risk Mitigation and Control:
	+ Develop and implement strategies to reduce or control the impact of identified risks.
	+ Establish and enforce policies, procedures, and preventive measures.
* Compliance and Regulatory Management:
	+ Ensure adherence to relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
	+ Monitor regulatory changes and adjust risk management strategies accordingly.
* Crisis and Incident Response:
	+ Develop and maintain contingency plans for various risk scenarios.
	+ Coordinate and lead responses to emergencies to minimize disruptions.
* Training and Education:
	+ Provide training programs on risk awareness and management practices.
	+ Educate employees and stakeholders on the importance of adhering to risk-related policies.
* Monitoring and Reporting:
	+ Continuously monitor the effectiveness of risk mitigation strategies.
	+ Regularly report risk assessments, actions taken, and trends to senior management.
* Collaboration and Communication:
	+ Collaborate with different departments to integrate risk management practices.
	+ Ensure effective communication to promote a shared understanding of risk management roles.
* Data Analysis:
	+ Utilize data and analytics to identify patterns, trends, and emerging risks.
	+ Proactively address potential issues through data-driven risk management.
* Continuous Improvement:
	+ Regularly review and refine risk management processes based on lessons learned.
	+ Stay informed about best practices and adapt strategies to changes in the business environment.
  


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES**


* Proven experience in risk analysis
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Ability to work independently or as part of a team
* Detail oriented

  


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**


* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Risk Management, or a related field.
* Knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.
  


If you are a proactive individual with a passion for risk management and a keen eye for detail, we invite you to apply for the Risk Analyst position and contribute to the overall success and stability of our organization.

  


**EMPLOYEE BENEFITS**


* Competitive compensation packages including bonuses and options
* Medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Matching 401(K)
* Paid time off
* Telecommuting and remote work options
* Support for continuing education
* Team off-sites, social events, annual company events, and frequent extracurricular activities
* Unlimited snacks and drinks (while in office)

  

**THE COMPANY**



B-Stock is the world's largest B2B recommerce marketplace for excess [or surplus] merchandise. Businesses of all sizes leverage the B-Stock platform to sell and buy customer returns, overstock and other excess merchandise - ranging from top brands and retailers who want best-in-class inventory management to entrepreneurs looking to source valuable merchandise for their resale businesses.



Tens of thousands of small business owners all over the globe use B-Stock to launch and power their resale business. We take pride in empowering these innovators and entrepreneurs of commerce.



In 2020 we sold 120 million items across our platform, giving a second life to this otherwise would be "waste" merchandise. In fact, we kept 400 million pounds of goods in use and saved millions from the landfill. It feels good to be B-Stock!



The amount of returned or unsold inventory continues to grow each year, and in 2020, it was estimated at over $1 trillion worth worldwide. We know there is tremendous value in and demand for this inventory - no matter the category, condition, or location. The B-Stock platform gives buyers a simple way to buy brand-name merchandise directly from top retailers and manufacturers. At the same time, we offer companies an automated, trusted replacement for traditional liquidation while boosting operational efficiency, recovery rates, and cycle time.



Led by eBay veterans and backed by top investors including Spectrum Equity, True Ventures, and Susquehanna Growth Equity, B-Stock shows no signs of slowing down. Our core values have shaped the company we are today and will continue to drive our success for many years to come.



For more information, visit bstock.com/careers/  

  

**OUR VALUES**  

  

***Make Each Dollar Count***  

Whether it's the recovery amount or a buyer's budget, money matters to all of our clients. And because each dollar matters to them, it matters to us.


***Take Our Work Seriously, Not Ourselves***  

Everything at B-Stock continues to grow - everything but our egos, that is. We're not afraid to let loose and laugh (often at ourselves).


***Do The Hard Things Today That Will Pay Off Tomorrow***  

We're willing to sacrifice and endure, fail and adapt to reach our long-term goals.


***Use Trust As The Best Measure Of Success***  

The trust we earn along the way is more valuable than money. Without trust from both our buyers and sellers, our business won't succeed.


***Find Strength In Numbers***  

Use our passion for data to provide value to our customers, improve ourselves, and develop new ways to delight our buyers and sellers.  

  

*No applicant will face discrimination/harassment based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on "protected categories," B-Stock also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at B-Stock.*  

  

*Work Authorization required.*

title: Benefit Coding Tech Analyst
description:
Join Our Team: Do Meaningful Work and Improve People’s Lives
Our purpose, to improve customers’ lives by making healthcare work better, is far from ordinary. And so are our employees. Working at Premera means you have the opportunity to drive real change by transforming healthcare.  

To better serve our customers, we’re creating a culture that promotes employee growth, collaborative innovation, and inspired leadership. We are committed to creating an environment where employees can do their best work and where best-in-class talent comes, stays, and thrives! As a result of these efforts we are proud to share that Forbes ranked Premera among America’s 2023 Best Midsize Employers and America's 2023 Best Employers By State.
Learn how Premera supports our members, customers and the communities that we serve through our Healthsource blog: https://healthsource.premera.com.*This is a Work from Home Position!!**Interested in a Leadership role? This is a position for you!**Interested in professional development and being in a job with career possibilities?**Prefer candidates with Claims, Customer Service, Project Management, and strong communication skills.*
The Benefit Coding Technical Support Analyst acts as technical resource for the Product Configuration team providing research, analysis, and support for a wide range of process, system, and workload issues. They respond to inquiries and collaborate with business partners to analyze and facilitate alternatives and recommendations for standard and custom product configuration. They use their knowledge of Premera systems and processes as well as state and federal regulations and guidelines to identify risks and escalate possible product configuration issues. They develop procedures and training for the Product Configuration team.
What you will do:* Provide technical support to product configuration teams including root cause analysis, research of system issues, immediate migrations, claims research, customizations, creation of product components, and recommendations on corrective actions for benefit coding errors. Respond to inquiries from team as well as other teams on benefit coding, interpretation of benefits and product builds.
* Research and provide direction to teams on complex benefit coding and compliance issues. Provide input to IT and team on custom benefit requests and make recommendations for alternative approaches. Identify, formulate, and approve criteria for new programming logic related to benefit coding and monitor through final testing.
* Collaborate with teams including sales, system configuration, claims, contract services, group set-up, membership and billing, customer service and others on feasibility and processing requirements for new and custom products and services.
* Create, maintain, and communicate detailed documentation, including work flow and process flows, policies, procedures, and action plans to address new and changing work to mitigate any risks. Develop processes and procedures for new and changing requirements.
* Participates in cross-functional teams/work groups to identify implementation considerations for new products/groups, gap reviews, or to resolve system related issues.
* Develop training content and provide instruction to staff both 1:1 and in a classroom setting. Work collaboratively with training staff in developing training programs.
* Monitor delivery and tracking for a wide range of inquiries, activities, and workload within team providing direction to team members and on-going status reports to leadership.
* Work closely with customer service and contract services for language needed to develop and maintain the benefit quoting tool (BQT) database.
* Other duties as assigned.


What you will bring:* An Associates’ degree in a business, information systems, or a related area or two (2) years of work experience (Required).
* Five (5) years of technical experience in benefit coding or claims adjudication or related area which includes at least one year experience in product configuration or equivalent (Required).
* Bachelor’s degree.
* Previous experience in Premera product configuration.
* Previous experience troubleshooting production issues within claims or customer information systems or databases.


#LI-REMOTE
What we offer* Medical, vision and dental coverage
* Life and disability insurance
* Retirement programs (401K employer match and pension plan)
* Wellness incentives, onsite services, a discount program and more
* Tuition assistance for undergraduate and graduate degrees
* Generous Paid Time Off to reenergize
* Free parking


Equal employment opportunity/affirmative action:
Premera is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Premera seeks to attract and retain the most qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.
If you need an accommodation to apply online for positions at Premera, please contact Premera Human Resources via email at careers@premera.com or via phone at 425-918-4785.
Premera is hiring in the following states, with some limitations based on role or city: Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Maine, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Carolina, Oklahoma, Oregon, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Washington, Wisconsin*.*
The pay for this role will vary based on a range of factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s geographic location, market conditions, and specific skills and experience.
National Salary Range:
$67,800.00 - $98,400.00
National Plus Salary Range:
$67,800.00 - $112,200.00* *National Plus salary range is used in higher cost of labor markets including Western Washington and Alaska**.*

title: Coverage Analyst (Remote)
description:
### **Description and Requirements**

  

**ABOUT WCG****:** WCG’s clinical solutions are built on a foundation of best-in-class clinical services companies. We deliver transformational solutions that stimulate growth, foster compliance, and maximize efficiency for those performing clinical trials. WCG is proud to serve individuals on the frontlines of science and medicine, and the organizations striving to develop new products and therapies to improve the quality of human health. It is our role to empower them to accelerate advancement, while ensuring the risks of progress never outweigh the value of human life.

 **WHY WE LOVE WCG****:** At WCG, our employees are our most valuable asset, and as with all our assets, we invest in them with an eye toward future success. We provide each eligible employee with a comprehensive set of benefits designed to protect their personal and financial health to help make the most of their future.

* Comprehensive Benefits package - Health, Dental, Vision, Life Disability, 401k with match, and flexible spending accounts
* Employee Assistance Programs and additional work/life resources
* Referral Bonuses and Tuition Reimbursement
* Paid time off including holidays, vacation, and sick time
* Volunteer Time Off to benefit the community
* Opportunities for career development with on-the-job training, certification assistance, and continuing education reimbursement


Expected hourly rate of pay range: $24.80 to $34.60


GPS level: P1

**JOB SUMMARY:**The Coverage Analyst is responsible for completing coverage analysis tasks with the primary goal of supporting the efficient and effective start-up process for our site clients.

 **ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:**To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The accountabilities listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required.

* Contribute to the development of clinical trial coverage analysis. Specific duties may vary depending on team assignment and business needs:
	+ Read and analyze clinical trial protocols and develop activity grid to identify required tests, procedures, and assessments.
	+ Interpret Medicare policies, clinical practice guidelines, and other related documents to make billing determinations related to the clinical trials.
	+ Use software and other internal resources to identify potential CPT/HCPCS codes for applicable items in the activity grid.
	+ Review work completed by others as part of the internal quality review process.
* Other duties as assigned by supervisor. These may, on occasion, be unrelated to the position described here.
* Attendance and punctuality are essential functions of the position.

**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:** Bachelor’s degree in related field. Significant work experience in the specific field may be considered in lieu of a relevant degree.

**QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE:**

* Ability to work in a performance-driven environment: a proactive, results-driven and goal-oriented approach.
* Demonstrated ability to learn and apply technical and scientific product-related information in a consultative manner.
* Excellent attention to detail and highly organized.
* Ability to understand clinical terms and descriptors and strong investigative skills with ability to think “outside the box”.
* Excellent communication (oral/written) and interpersonal skills.
* Proficient with Excel.
* Preferred but not required:
	+ Familiarity with the clinical trial start-up process
	+ Experience reading an interpreting clinical trial protocols.
	+ Familiarity with research billing guidelines (e.g. Medicare NCD 310.1) and/or general healthcare billing processes (coding, Medicare regulations, etc.).

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS**:

* 0% – 5%
* 5% - 10%
* 10% - 20%
* 20% - 50%
* >50%
  

**Physical and Sensory Requirements:**The physical and sensory requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be offered to individuals with disabilities to assist in performing the essential functions of the position. Work activities involve light to moderate physical effort (for example, sitting in one place for extended periods of time, standing, walking, bending, lifting lightweight objects, intermittent to sustained periods of keyboarding). Majority of time is spent in a seated position with frequent opportunity to move about at will. Activities require a variety of easy muscle movements. Work activities involve a frequent need to concentrate on a variety of sensory inputs for moderate to lengthy durations at a time requiring diligence and attention to interpret effectively. There will be a need to attend to single or simultaneous tasks where accuracy of details is important. The need for detailed and precise work is high.


#LI-Remote  

**WCG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer** – Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin or ancestry, religion or creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran status, reprisal or any other legally recognized basis or status protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Compliance Analyst I
description:
Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest.


Affirm's Compliance team designs and implements a compliance program that enables Affirm to proactively adhere to regulatory requirements while also identifying and addressing potential regulatory issues that may arise. Compliance program activities include advisory, training, independent testing & monitoring, reporting, escalation, and oversight. As a second line of defense, Compliance proactively partners with the business to support new products, markets, and initiatives, change management, issue identification, and remediation plans, assessment and monitoring of third parties, and provides trends and data to enable informed decision making, strengthen controls or provide for better treatment of consumer.



Affirm is seeking a Compliance Analyst to join its testing team in driving critical compliance management elements. In this role, the Compliance Analyst will support the assessment of compliance risks and controls. This includes providing assistance on internal reviews to ensure compliance with regulations, engaging business partners, and collaborating with management to achieve Compliance Testing Program objectives. This role will report to the Compliance Testing Manager and will be required to work independently and cross-functionally.



What you'll do


* Works with the lead tester to complete federal and state reviews, which consist of executing the testing phase of the Compliance Testing lifecycle with minimal management oversight.
* Assist with the ongoing compliance testing activities on adherence to compliance program and federal/state regulatory requirements.
* Deliver accurate, in depth, and well documented fieldwork and collaborate with the lead tester to define identified issues.
* Work closely and cross functionally with multiple departments (Compliance, Risk, Legal Product, etc) while completing reviews.
* Support a very fast paced business with tight deadlines while providing diligent and detailed work product.
* Support other key compliance and risk management projects as needed.

  




What we look for


* 2+ years of professional work experience in Compliance Testing, Quality Assurance, or Audit preferred.
* Experience working with consumer financial regulations and laws that impact Affirm's business including BSA/AML, UDAAP, CAN-SPAM, FCRA, Reg. E, Reg. P, Reg. B (ECOA) Reg. Z.
* A self-starter that is proactive in proposing creative and effective solutions.
* Inquisitive with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
* Proficient computer navigation skills using a variety of software packages, including Google Workspace and internal operating systems.
* Strong project management, critical thinking, and analytical skills with the ability to meet tight deadlines.
* A strong curiosity about fintech and consumer finance.
* Must be detail oriented, thorough, and well organized.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  


  

Pay Grade - USA25  

Employees new to Affirm or promoted into a new role, typically begin in the min to mid range.  

USA base pay range (CA, WA, NY, NJ, CT) per year:  

Min: $80,500  

Mid: $92,600  

Max: $104,600  

  

USA base pay range (all other U.S. states) per year:  

Min: $72,400  

Mid: $83,300  

Max: $94,200  

  

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  

LI-Remote



Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and you can work almost anywhere within the country of employment. Affirmers in proximal roles have the flexibility to work remotely, but will occasionally be required to work out of their assigned Affirm office. A limited number of roles remain office-based due to the nature of their job responsibilities.



We're extremely proud to offer competitive benefits that are anchored to our core value of people come first. Some key highlights of our benefits package include:


* Health care coverage - Affirm covers all premiums for all levels of coverage for you and your dependents
* Flexible Spending Wallets - generous stipends for spending on Technology, Food, various Lifestyle needs, and family forming expenses
* Time off - competitive vacation and holiday schedules allowing you to take time off to rest and recharge
* ESPP - An employee stock purchase plan enabling you to buy shares of Affirm at a discount


We believe It's On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.



[For U.S. positions that could be performed in Los Angeles or San Francisco] Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, Affirm will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.



By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy for applicants within the United States, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Poland) for applicants applying from Poland, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Spain) for applicants applying from Spain, or the Affirm U.K. Limited Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data for applicants applying from the United Kingdom, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

title: Insurance Product Analyst
description:
**:: Applicant Notice ::** 

**This is not a technical product analyst/manager/owner role. Direct, related experience in insurance product development is required for this role.**

Steadily is an insurance technology company that specializes in rental property insurance for landlords. We’re three years old, just over 100 people, manage $6B in risk, and are intent on becoming the world’s best and largest insurer of rental properties. We exist to deliver fast, affordable insurance and to pay claims quickly and fairly. To do that, we hire the best engineers, actuaries, sales, and service people in the country to build the experience that we’d want if we were the client.

We’re looking for an **Insurance Product Analyst** who is the very best at what they do. You'll be surrounded by team members who are also the very vest at what they do which will just make you even better.

**What You'll Do**

* You’ll have ultimate responsibility for the growth and profitability of our DP3 products in several states.
* Enhance the coverage and form language of our existing products. Draft new endorsements.
* Assist with analysis of the drivers of profitability including loss ratios, actuarial indications, frequency/severity trends, retention and other data for all products, books and channels.
* Manage rate filings in the states to ensure we are priced to achieve the required return across all products and segments.
* Coordinate and collaborate with various internal teams while executing the insurance product function at Steadily.
* Competitive analysis / SERFF ninja

**Ideal Background**

* **Experienced**: You’ve been a high achiever in insurance for over two years. You have experience with personal lines products. Bonus points for direct experience in HO or DP products. You have created or edited policy form language.
* **Builder**: You have a builder’s mindset and can take projects and products from inception to launch and beyond. You have a bias towards action.
* **Digital**: Your tech savvy is exceptional. You have strong product sense and are a master of learning and implementing new software and processes. Your technical and analytical skills are top notch.
* **Hungry**: You want to make the leap into an early-stage tech startup to rapidly accelerate your growth and have real impact.

**Compensation**

* At least $100,000+ per year

We believe in paying top-of-market to attract the best person for each role. However, the compensation package is usually the second reason people choose to join a startup. The primary reason is they want to experience the growth that comes from pouring your heart and soul into building something that people love. That’s what we do.

**Benefits**

* Equity in the company
* Traditional Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance
* 3 weeks PTO + Paid Holidays
* 401K

**Why Join Us**

* You'll be in good company. Our founders have three successful startups under their belt, and have recruited a stellar team to match.
* We pay top of market (see comp).
* We're earlier stage, so you'll get to wear a lot of hats and shape product decisions.
* We have a good time. Culture matters a ton to us.
* We're growing fast and are exceptionally well-funded.
* Steadily boasts a very unique culture that our teammates love. We call it like we see it and we’re nothing if not candid. Check out our culture deck here to learn what we’re all about.
* Steadily was awarded Comparably’s Best Company Leadership 2023, Best CEOs for Women 2023, and Best Company for Women 2022

**Locations**

* While we are an in-person first company, we do consider remote hires for highly qualified candidates in highly specialized roles like this one.
* If you are remote, but willing to consider relocation, your offer will include a generous relocation package.

**Read What's Being Said About Steadily**

Press Room*(News)* **|** TrustPilot*(Clients)* **|** Comparably *(Employees)*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Relocation assistance
* Vision insurance

Work Location: Remote

title: Verification Specialist
description:
**MISSION**


Missions are accomplished with people, driving towards a greater purpose. Foley has been a trusted partner to motor carriers of all sizes. Our technologically advanced approach to DOT compliance automates many of the background screening and compliance requirements motor carriers must comply with- making it easier for them to onboard and retain the right driver for their business. At Foley we just don’t help our customers stay compliant – we help them thrive.


A positive attitude is everything. At Foley, we’ve created a culture that rewards kindness, enthusiasm, and a can-do attitude. Whether we’re working together internally or helping a customer solve a problem, we approach every challenge with a sense of humor, optimism, and the determination to succeed.


**VERIFICATION SPECIALIST ON A BACKGROUND SCREENING TEAM**


Are you skilled at conducting thorough and efficient investigative research? Join us as a Verification Specialist on our Background Screening Team, where your meticulous approach will play a pivotal role in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of our processes. Seize this opportunity to grow your career within a collaborative environment that values individual contribution and teamwork.


***This is a remote option****- those residing in CT, NC, MA, NH, NE, SC, GA, FL, TX, TN, NJ, IN, PA are welcome to apply!*


*This position pays $18.15 per hour.*


**WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH**


As a Verification Specialist, you'll operate under general supervision, utilizing your independent judgment to achieve optimal results. In this role, you'll collaborate with fellow Verification Specialists, Criminal Research Specialists, and Quality Control Specialists. Our culture thrives on cross-functional cooperation, welcoming fresh ideas that can further enhance our processes.


**WHAT YOU WILL DO**


* Contact educational institutions, companies, licensing agencies, and other entities through phone, email, and web to gather and verify information crucial for background screening requests.
* Handle Personal Identifying Information (PII) with the utmost confidentiality and responsibility.
* Maintain meticulous records and notes, documenting your research steps and the actions taken to complete each verification request.
* Communicate efficiently and effectively with all relevant parties involved in the verification process.
* Compile accurate and grammatically correct reports summarizing the data obtained from research and verification interviews.
* Provide a professional and efficient service to both internal and external customers, ensuring swift issue resolution.
* Uphold a performance level that consistently meets or surpasses the department's quality goals.
* Safeguard both company and customer information according to company policies and procedures.


**WHAT WE’D LIKE YOU TO HAVE**


* A minimum of 2+ years of customer service, research, or investigative experience is preferred.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
* Experience and a demonstrated ability to conduct research for business information online.
* Strong proficiency with computer applications, including the Microsoft Office Suite and web-based tools.
* Familiarity with handling sensitive data.
* The ability to excel both independently and as a valuable team member.
* A commitment to maintaining performance that aligns with or exceeds the department's quality benchmarks.


At our organization, your meticulous research skills will contribute to the integrity and reliability of our background screening processes. Join our team and make a tangible impact while enjoying the flexibility of remote work. We're excited to welcome your fresh insights and expertise into our collaborative environment.


**WHAT YOU’LL LOVE ABOUT FOLEY**


* **The people!** Our employees and customers consistently express the best thing about Foley is our close-knit, exceptionally talented teams. Check out our customers feedback – on Trustpilot.
* **Outstanding benefits.** 3 medical plans to choose from, 2 level dental, and 2 level vision plans. Generous vacation, sick, and personal time off. 401K plan with a match. We’ve got your back so you can live your best life.
* **It’s about ideas over egos.** You will have the freedom to explore new ideas and approaches in an entrepreneurial environment, supported by a collaborative team.
* **Professional growth.** We open our roles to our employees first and encourage them to apply for growth opportunities. Our People Operations team is available to discuss career growth and help put a plan in place, helping employees achieve the growth they crave.
* **Our environment!** We celebrate success and believe in transparency and teamwork to get us there. We invest in collaboration tools so you can meet with your team face to face. Many of our roles are remote and we want to ensure our employees are engaged and can interact with their peers in a virtual space.


**What We Do, How We Do It**


Too often, companies use a piecemeal approach when it comes to screening drivers. They might use one vendor to help recruit. Another to screen. And still, another to address the complex world that is compliance. This approach is inefficient, expensive, and redundant. Not to mention, it makes it too easy for things to fall through the cracks.


At Foley, we've built a company that effortlessly manages these three areas under one roof: recruit, screen, comply. Thanks to powerful technology combined with our compliance expertise, we're able to deliver a comprehensive solution to our customers and, as a result, a better overall customer experience.


**Where We're Headed**


We're always developing new solutions to slay tomorrow's recruitment, screening, and compliance monsters. At the core of these solutions is our vast collection of data—and the many ways to leverage it, whether that's developing software to calculate a company's compliance risk or implementing predictive analytics to identify the best drivers.


**What It's Like to Work with Us**


Diving deep into a niche industry and becoming an expert . . .


Continually growing and advancing . . .


Making lifelong friends during the process . . .


That sums up what it's like to work for us. We're a 250+ person company on the verge of explosive growth thanks to our AI-powered technology—and where it's headed with predictive analytics. If you'd like to board our rocket ship, check us out:


**www.foleyservices.com**

title: RCO Analyst- Remote
description:
Overview:

This role will support the Sr. Manager of Revenue Cycle Optimization to improve and deliver positive change within all the RCM service lines across Financial Clearance, Central Business Office (CBO), and both AR Follow-up Teams. This role will be an integral part of the Revenue Cycle team working directly with Revenue Cycle Management leaders on improving processes, identifying quality improvement initiatives, and special projects. RCO Analyst will support the department through performing data analyses, interviewing team members and vendor partners, observing processes, collaborating with external departments, summarizing findings, and providing solutions to revenue cycle barriers as it pertains to internal / external factors or our vendor partners. The RCO Analyst will also be responsible for assisting RCO leadership with SOX management, RCM administrative functionality, Denials Management, and vendor management.
Responsibilities:
* Utilize analytical skills and RCM business intelligence tools to review datasets and identify insights to drive strategic recommendations across all RCM service lines to improve operational and revenue recognition results
* Leads the Denial Management Task Force (DMTF). Generates and monitors Denial Management trend reports, researches Payor/CARC combinations or assigns to DMTF team members to identify root causes through interviews, observation, account sampling, and/or data analysis. Create action plans to resolve. Provides reporting to RCM Senior leadership.
* Assists RCO leadership on vendor management duties, including but not limited to SLA reviews, optimization projects with vendor process improvement teams, invoice audits, vendor technology review and implementation, contract creation/review, etc.
* Assists RCO leadership with non-RCM initiated projects. Collaborates with Directors, Sr./Managers, Supervisors both within and outside of RCM to perform risk assessments, create project plans, and implement external department projects that require RCM collaboration.
* Other projects as assigned.


Qualifications:
**Minimum Education**  

**Required:**  

* High School Diploma, GED, or suitable equivalent

**Preferred:**  

* Associate / bachelor’s degree
 **Minimum Experience**  

**Required:**  

* 3+ years in healthcare revenue cycle
* 2+ years in analytical work
* Strong Excel skills, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and other formula-based Excel.
* Offshore vendor experience

**Preferred:**  

* 5+ years in healthcare revenue cycle
 **Knowledge Skills and Abilities**  

* Strong attention to detail and analytical skills
* Strong MS excel skills required with additional experience with other analytical tools preferred.
* Ability to solve problems and get to the root cause of any issue, no matter how complex it is, by investigating and suggesting solutions.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
* Ability to maintain friendly, cordial relations with all business partners; maintain a positive work relationship with customers, co-workers, and mangers.

title: Service Desk Analyst
description:
Service Desk Analyst - IT Authorities, a WidePoint Company - **Remote based in Florida**  

  

IT Authorities, a WidePoint Company, WidePoint Corporation (WYY) is a leading provider of wireless mobility management and cybersecurity solutions. We offer secure, cloud-based, enterprise-wide information technology-based solutions that enable enterprises and government agencies to deploy fully compliant IT services in accordance with government-mandated regulations and advanced system requirements.  

  

We are looking for a highly motivated Service Desk Analyst that can operate in a fast-paced and demanding start-up like environment of a micro-cap publicly-traded company.  

  

A Day in the Life...
The Service Desk Analyst provides technical support and guidance to resolve user's computer hardware and software problems. Communicates with users via phone, chat, email, and support ticketing system to assess the scope of the problem and determine what, if any, resolution steps users have performed.
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
-----------------------------------------


The essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following:


* Providing daily remote maintenance and repair, including but not limited to laptops, desktops, printers, and email.


* Documenting job-specific processes and new processes to assist in managing the customer's infrastructure and systems and the Support Knowledge Base.


* Documenting problem resolutions in the Support Knowledge Base.


* Maintaining client documentation using Microsoft Visio and Customer Relationship Management (MS CRM).


* Maintaining relevant, up-to-date knowledge of operating systems, network technologies, and support technologies.


* Following the documented ticket workflows and processes.


* Remoting into hardware to troubleshoot laptops, desktops, and servers


* Documenting, tracking, and monitoring incidents to ensure a timely solution.


* Identifying, researching, and resolving technical issues.


* Performs other related duties as assigned.


You own this if you have...
The minimum qualifications include:


* High school diploma or equivalent required.


* Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP), Network+, A+ certification, or equivalent preferred


* Experience with some of the following technologies:


o Microsoft Office and desktop operating systems (including Windows and Mac).
o Antivirus and malware applications (e.g., Webroot and Malwarebytes.)
o Network printing (e.g., troubleshooting driver issues and mapping errors.)
o Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) tools (e.g., ConnectWise and ServiceNow.)
* Ability to work flexible schedules, including 1st, 2nd, and 3rd shifts.


**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
-----------------------------------------


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the functions.
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to fifteen (15) pounds at times.

**Note**: This position description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other position-related instructions and to perform any other position-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. All duties and responsibilities are essential functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. To perform this position successfully, the incumbents will possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. Some requirements may exclude individuals who pose a direct threat or significant risk to the health or safety of themselves or others. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.
The company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, drug free workplace, and complies with ADA regulations as applicable.
We believe the culture of a company is only as good as how people feel each and every day about their role and the colleagues they work with. Culture is the single most important element of a company that is also bound to the operations and deliverables to the customers. If operations are a mess, so will be the culture. People can only work in an environment that doesn’t accomplish its goals for so long. That is why we believe culture and operations are closely tied together. From an operations perspective, our vision is for unprecedented accuracy, precision and professionalism. We have some philosophies that have guided us through our years of business and have made us the company we are today:  

• CANI – Constant And Never-ending Improvement. We work every day to be better than the day before.  

• 212° - “At 211 degrees, water is hot. At 212 degrees, it boils. And with boiling water, comes steam. And with steam, you can power a train.” This translates for us to be your very best. The extra degree can be applied to your entire life. What does adding an extra degree of effort to your relationships, your family, your job, etc. do? If you will just add an extra degree each and every time, you will soar in life.  

• I work harder on myself than I do my job. If you are working harder on your job than you do your life, you have the cart before the horse. Family first here at IT Authorities and we not only encourage personal development, we teach it too! Within the first two weeks of joining the IT Authorities family you will go through our Dream Board session which is a blueprint for living a high performance and healthy life.  

  

We look to attract and retain talent by finding people who align with our core values:  

• Cares – If you don’t care for people or for personal life improvement this is not the role for you. In our business, caring is absolutely vital for all parties involved.  

• Do the right thing – No explanation needed here.  

• Extreme Ownership – People who possess this character trait soar within IT Authorities.  

• Grow or Die – Our people feel like if they are not growing, they feel like they are dying. They have an insatiable desire to grow both personally and professionally.  

  

Note: This position description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other position-related instructions and to perform any other position-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. All duties and responsibilities are essential functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. To perform this position successfully, the incumbents will possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. Some requirements may exclude individuals who pose a direct threat or significant risk to the health or safety of themselves or others. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an "at will" relationship.  

  

The Company does not currently sponsor any candidates that do not have the legal right and eligibility to work in the United States.
  

  

The company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, drug free workplace, and complies with ADA regulations as applicable.

title: Asset Management Analyst
description:
Connexus Credit Union - Who We Are:
Serving members across all 50 states, Connexus Credit Union is a member-focused cooperative that is proud to return profits to member-owners through high yields for checking accounts and deposit products, as well as competitive rates for personal, home, and auto loans. From its early beginnings on through the years, Connexus has remained a strong, growing, and secure financial institution that remains committed to serving the financial needs of our member-owners across the country.
Connexus offers an Amazing Benefits package:* 25 days of paid time off and 7 paid holidays
* 16 hours of paid Volunteer Time Off
* 401K Retirement with up to 6% employer match
* Excellent Health, Dental, Vision insurance, including multiple plan options
* Health Savings Account with generous employer contributions
* Employer paid Life insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Tuition Reimbursement from $4,000 - $7,000 per calendar year
* Robust Learning and Development program that includes an annual professional development stipend

  

Connexus has a Values-Based Culture:
Our Values of Integrity, Respect, Transparency, Wellbeing and Synergy aren't just words on a page; our values dictate the actions of the organization and everyone within it. We demonstrate our values in every personal interaction, phone call, and email ‐ every day.
About the Position:
The Asset Management Analyst is primarily responsible for the daily and long-term strategic management of the software and hardware used to fulfill the services provided by the Division of Business Technology (BT). This includes acquisition and deployment of software and hardware assets, management and maintenance throughout their service life, and safe and secure disposal upon retirement. The Asset Management Analyst will assist in developing and executing IT Asset Management strategies that optimize technology spending, demonstrate good stewardship of corporate and IT resources, and align with best practices for maintaining compliance.
Reporting to the ITSM Manager, the Asset Management Analyst will centrally manage assets from pre-procurement planning through end of service life. The Asset Management Analyst will also manage BT's product standards, ensuring newly acquired assets align with, are added to, or excepted from same, according to established procedures. Liaising with the Endpoint Operations Manager, IT Operations Manager, and other technology management, you will contribute to activities that help BT identify and acquire technology assets in a manner that acknowledges budget allocations, and leverages redistribution opportunities and economies of scale. The Asset Management Analyst will also oversee IT asset intake, ensuring items are received, invoiced, inventoried, insured, and prepared for service deployment. He or she will plan, participate in, and oversee initiatives to discover and track IT assets throughout their service life, compiling information on asset configuration, warranty, locality, custodianship, and repair status. Finally, the Asset Management Analyst will create and execute plans and procedures for readying IT assets for end of service life, and for ensuing hardware assets are disposed according to Information Security, Data Protection, Enterprise Risk Management, and environmental safety requirements.
Success will be measured in terms of ability to develop and execute strategies and methods for ensuring all IT assets are known, classified, tracked in near-real-time, audited for compliance, and disposed according to vendor contracts, corporate policies, industry standards, and other applicable controls. Key objectives also include the ability to deliver insights regarding utilization and total cost of ownership for our IT assets.
Responsibilities:
Hardware Asset Management:* Maintain an accurate and up-to-date inventory of IT assets, including desktops, laptops, servers, peripherals, software, and licenses.
* Liaise with the BT leaders to identify and acquire IT hardware in a manner that acknowledges budget allocations, leverages redistribution, and conforms to established product standards and desired technical specifications.
* Oversee IT asset intake, invoicing, inventory, and preparation for service deployment.
* Develop and execute methods and tools for tracking IT assets throughout their service life, including information on configuration, warranty, locality, custodianship, and repair status.
* Develop and execute methods for protecting against and responding to asset theft or compromise, according to corporate policies for Information Security, Data Protection, and Enterprise Risk Management, as well as applicable laws and regulations.
* Track hardware warranty periods and proactively plan for continued non-warranty use and support, or retirement.
* Work with other BT areas to configure the Service Mapping and load data / dependencies identified by Service Mapping into the Asset Management Database.
* Assist the BT staff in the integration/ field mapping and reconciliation of data from Ivanti discovery, Service Mapping, and ad hoc loads in the configuration management module.
* Responsible for coordinating with BT areas with maintaining ITAM data, which is not discoverable by automated tools, and verifying CIs are appropriately input with correct relationship mapping.


Software Asset Management:* Liaise with the BT leaders to identify and acquire software products or licenses in a manner that acknowledges budget allocations, leverages redistribution opportunities for existing entitlements, and maximizes economies of scale for enterprise platform solutions.
* Manage and maintain a collection of End User License Agreements (EULA) and other software contracts or terms of use to guide compliance efforts.
* Manage and maintain a Definitive Software Library (DSL) containing media and/or install packages for all deployed software products.
* Develop and execute methods and tools for tracking software allocation and utilization, including information on consumption, warranty, and custodianship.
* Conduct quarterly audit of software in use and measure for compliance with End User License Agreements (EULA) and other terms of use.
* Track software warranty periods and proactively plan for renewal, true-up, or retirement.


Other Service Management Duties:* Maintain BT's list of product standards, and oversee additions, exceptions, and deletions according to established procedures.
* Prepare and present reports for various audiences in the BT Division, and to senior or executive leadership as directed.
* Seek out opportunities and advise on efforts to improve efficiency and reduce waste by streamlining ITAM or other ITSM operations.
* Conduct routine audits of ITAM Configuration Items (CIs) to ensure that the data is accurate. Conduct reporting on configuration audits and reconciliation.
* Assist in developing, modifying, and configuring reports, dashboards, and outputs associated with the change, configuration, discovery, and mapping functions.


Position Requirements:* This position is Remote.
* Bachelor’s degree or commensurate experience is Required.
* 3+ years of experience as a CMDB Administrator or in Asset Management is Required.
* Experience using ITAM tools for discovery, tracking, and management. Experience with Ivanti Endpoint Manager and/or Ivanti Service Manager is highly desired.
* Proficiency with ITSM terms and concepts, or ITIL Foundations certificate (ITIL4 preferred).


Connexus Credit Union's Recent Recognitions:* 2022 Best Credit Union – Bankrate
* 2022 Best Checking Account – Forbes Advisor
* 2022 Best Credit Union in the U.S – Kiplinger
* Fourth Largest Credit Union in Wisconsin (by asset size)

*Equal Opportunity* *Employer/Disabled/Veterans/41* *CFR 60–1.4, 41 CFR 60-1.35*

title: GRC Analyst (Risk Focus)
description:
VerSprite Staffing is a subsidiary of VerSprite Cybersecurity. Specializing in technology staffing and utilizing a network of technical clients, VerSprite Staffing connects top level technical talent with industry clients through various methods and expands not only clients talent network, but candidates job search as well. At the bottom line, VerSprite adds value to both clients and candidates alike.



We work with clients to fill both full-time and contracting opportunities, so If the following job interests you, please apply to learn more!

**Job Description:**


**Summary:** We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced GRC Consultant with a strong focus on risk management to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks that may impact our client's operations, compliance, and strategic objectives. This role requires a deep understanding of risk management frameworks, compliance standards, technical infosec tools and technologies, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.


**Key Responsibilities:**



* **Risk Identification and Assessment:**


* Conduct comprehensive risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities.
* Analyze and prioritize risks based on their potential impact on the organization.
* Collaborate with department heads and subject matter experts to gather risk-related information.
* Evaluate technical vulnerability reports to contextualize actual the actual risks presented to the business.
* Assess network architecture and technical stacks to identify information security gaps.
* **Risk Monitoring:**


* Continuously monitor and analyze internal and external factors that could impact the organization's risk profile.
* Stay updated on industry trends, regulations, and emerging risks.
* **Risk Mitigation and Control:**


* Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies and controls to reduce exposure.
* Develop and monitor key risk indicators (KRIs) and key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure timely detection of emerging risks.
* Evaluate and recommend improvements to existing risk management processes and controls.
* **Compliance Management:**


* Stay updated on relevant industry regulations, standards, and best practices.
* Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements by developing and maintaining compliance programs.
* Assist in the preparation of compliance reports for regulatory agencies and internal stakeholders.
* **Reporting and Communication:**


* Prepare and deliver regular risk reports to senior management and stakeholders.
* Communicate risk findings and recommendations effectively to different levels of the organization.
* Collaborate with external auditors during audits and provide necessary documentation.
* Deliver quantitative risk reports.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:**


* Work closely with IT and security teams to assess and enhance cybersecurity controls.
* Collaborate with internal departments to implement risk mitigation measures and ensure compliance.
* Act as a subject matter expert and provide guidance on risk-related matters.
* Act as liaison to articulate specific technical findings into contextual business risk specific to the organization based on specific threats to the business sector.


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Risk Management, Business Administration, Information Security) [master's degree or relevant certifications a plus] or relevant experience.
* 3+ years of proven experience in GRC, with a focus on risk management.
* Strong knowledge of risk management frameworks (e.g., COSO) and industry standards (e.g., ISO 31000, NIST).
* Familiarity with compliance regulations and standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, SOX).
* Proficiency in risk assessment methodologies and tools.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Effective communication and presentation abilities.
* Ability to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
* Relevant certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISA, CRISC) a plus.
* Hands-on experience in working with cybersecurity tools to determine technology risks strongly preferred.

title: Payroll Ops Consultant
description:
Who We Are
  
  

Magnit is the future of work. Serving hundreds of the world’s most recognizable brands for the past 30+ years, Magnit offers the industry’s first holistic platform for the modern workforce. Magnit's integrated workforce management (IWM) platform supported by data, software, intelligence, and best-in-class services team is key to our clients’ success. It can adapt quickly to regional or industry economic shifts, and provides the speed, scale, flexibility, transparency, and expertise required to meet an organization’s contingent workforce management, talent strategy and broader organization goals. At Magnit, you’ll work with passionate colleagues who collaborate and deliver meaningful results that positively transform the largest companies around the globe.
  
  

The Team
  
The Client Payroll Operations (CPO) Team is a dynamic, high-energy team which provides top-tier contingent workforce payroll processing and support to Magnit field services teams domestically. The CPO team works cross-functionally with internal partners including Invoicing, Finance, Human Resources, Training, and Client Services (CS) to ensure payroll related transactions are processed accurately, timely, and compliantly for the diverse workforce that Magnit supports.
  
  

Day in the Life
  
Magnit is looking for a Payroll Operations Consultant to help support our Client Payroll teams work more effectively by utilizing key data elements. The Payroll Operations Consultant is responsible for providing expert advice and guidance to clients and key internal stakeholders on the execution of Magnit’s proprietary solutions, including process design, system configuration, and on-going payroll process execution/support. The Payroll Operations Consultant manages several client payroll processes including analyzing payroll operations processes, identifying areas for improvement, and developing solutions to enhance performance.
  
  

This role must work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to deliver world class service to our customers, their workforce, and colleagues to identify risk, consult and advise on best practices, and ensure internal and legal compliance. This critical role is looked upon to develop and meet defined key performance initiatives (KPI’s), implement process efficiencies, and foster a productive team environment. This role must also provide oversight, validation, and reconciliation of payroll processes and data management to ensure accuracy to support an outstanding service experience for our customers and their contingent workforces. The attention to detail required and continuous workflow makes this a great position for someone who enjoys a fast-paced, analytical role.
  
  

The Growth
  
This role benefits from the support of an experienced Supervisor of Payroll Operations who will work closely to provide guidance and feedback as you develop and progress in your role. We are committed to our employees’ growth – we have formalized development programs and actively advertise our open positions internally to support the internal movement.
  
  

What You Will Do
  
* Act as a consultant to internal and external stakeholders to determine business requirements and needs of customized payroll processes to identify and/or mitigate payroll risk. Consult, recommend, and partner with key stakeholders to carry out best-in-class solutions as appropriate in areas such as payroll, benefits, time, and human resources policy and procedures.
* Research, troubleshoot, and develop solutions for Magnit/client application issues in the areas of payroll system setup, payroll functionality, and general payroll client inquiries.
* Work with and mentor Client Payroll Operations Analysts to optimize daily payroll processing and to ensure every client interaction is a best-in-class experience.
* Collaborate with cross-functional leaders in identifying, escalating, developing short and long-term solutions and mitigating critical issues in a timely manner to ensure optimal system utilization and regulatory compliance at an enterprise-level.
* Collaborate with cross-functional leaders and teams to identify key payroll processes and requirements, areas for improvement in department-wide processes and strategy, and delivery of such continuous advancements.
* Independently develop and deliver client process documentation, governance, and execution on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).


What You Will Need
  
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Bachelor’s Degree required or 5+ years of payroll related work experience.
* PayrollOrg Fundamental Payroll Certification (FPC) or Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) designations preferred.
* Experience and ability to navigate multiple company systems in execution of the successful payroll process.
* Minimum of three years of demonstrated experience in HR Administration/HRMS, Payroll, and VMS software/environments. Experience with Employer of Record (EOR) payroll environments preferred.
* Positive outlook and attitude with solid technical and problem-solving skills. You will take the initiative to seek answers, solutions, and positive outcomes in a timely manner for both the client and Magnit.
* Possess the HR, payroll knowledge, and the necessary competencies to deliver value to Magnit’s clients.
* The ability to research complex payroll process issues and develop remediation plans to mitigate any risk to the client and Magnit. This includes the ability to perform basic and complex research and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.
* You will set priorities, organize your day, multi-task, change direction, and provide prompt follow-up. You will strive to exceed client expectations in every interaction.
* Anticipate and meet future client needs through effective planning that aligns with our vision, goals, and strategic initiatives.
* Possess intermediate or greater MS excel spreadsheet skills with a concentration on reference, lookup, and logical functions.
* The ability to measure, monitor, and control quality outcomes with strong process management skill working towards defined key performance metrics.
* Recognizing and resolving complex issues within appropriate timelines and with a sense of urgency.
* Partner with management in process change management and be adaptable to a flexible work environment while keeping focus on meeting defined goals and deliverables.
* Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SAS etc.) is a plus. Adept at queries and report writing is considered a plus


**Compensation:** The salary for the role ranges from $75,000-$85,000 USD annually.
  
\\*\\*Salary is based on experience skills, and geographical location\\*\\*
  
TA: Toni Priestley
  
  

What Magnit will Offer You
  
  

At Magnit,you’ll be joining an innovative, high-growth environment and can quickly make an impact to help transform the largest companies in the world. You will work with passionate colleagues who collaborate and deliver. Magnit offers all employees the opportunity for growth and development, and we want individuals to fulfill their potential and blaze their own trails!
  
  

Magnit will offer you a competitive benefits package, including unlimited PTO, medical,
  
  

dental, and vision coverage, retirement planning, as well as discounts and perks for tickets, travel, merchandise and more! Magnit encourages employees to participate in giving back, and we will match employee contributions to favorite charities and support corporate volunteering hours to make a difference in your community!
  
  

If this role isn’t for you
  
  

Stay in touch, we will let you know when we have new positions on the team. To see a complete list of our open career opportunities please visit
  
  

https://magnitglobal.com/us/en/company/careers.html
  
  

To do our best work we need different viewpoints. Therefore, we celebrate diversity and embrace inclusion.
  
  

As an equal opportunity employer, we are dedicated to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strive to ensure that we maintain a positive and enriching work environment for all.

title: IT Inventory Analyst (Remote- First)
description:
**\\*Must be located in Texas\\***

\\*  
About the Role\\*  
This position is responsible for supporting The Technology Team by handling a variety of operational tasks, including but not limited to, licensing management, asset management, new employee onboarding, governance compliance for audits, and other duties as assigned.  
**A Day in the Life**

* Act as main point of contact for new hire technology onboarding to ensure new hires are setup correctly and are aware of all security requirements and policies
* Manage day-to-day software operations and inquiries and maintaining accurate inventory of software licenses
* Build collaborative partnerships with key stakeholders to mitigate inherent risk associated with software asset ownership; conducts complex analysis where results are used to inform executive decisions
* Contribute to the development and implementation of enterprise-wide software asset management policies and procedures which minimizes compliance risk, enhances the program, and creates process efficiencies
* Respond to requests from end users, managers, developers, and team members for specific IT Software Asset Management reports
* Manage proof of entitlement documentation and asset authorizations
* Maintain an inventory of all software licenses, subscriptions, hardware assets across the organization; including life cycle monitoring
* Identifies savings opportunities for renewals, software licensing and services
* Track software subscriptions and licenses, working with Finance, Accounting, and Procurement to maintain compliance
* Meter and review software and hardware utilization and make recommendations on requirements
* Manage and maintain inventory database in ServiceNow of the software applications lifecycle
* Working knowledge of reconciling software licensing and software maintenance terms and conditions between procured rights and quantities to ensure licensing compliance of deployed software assets
* Drive efficiencies and cost-savings through software metering and monitoring
* Contribute in software audits with data gathering and license position reporting
* Review vendor invoices and confirm receipt and installation of software
* Manage relationships with vendors, suppliers to facilitate smooth flow of services and support
* Ensure project coordination for specific departmental projects
* Miscellaneous tasks as assigned

**What Sets You Apart**

* Strong analytical skills and demonstrated ability to organize, analyze, interpret, and present information; demonstrated experience with software asset management and/or software compliance; in-depth knowledge of software licensing, procurement lifecycles, policies, and procedure
* Ability to understand software license models and usage rights, conducting internal software license compliance reviews, and creating metrics-based reports for management review.
* Knowledge of hardware and software procurement processes, including vendor management and contract negotiation
* Familiarity with the software asset lifecycle, including reclamation of unused or underutilized licenses
* Must have proven organizational, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills; must be detailed oriented
* Ability to manage multiple stakeholders; including vendors, end users, and management
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work in a team-driven environment yet able to work independently and with initiative to complete daily expectations
* The ability to work flexibly in order to respond to changing priorities
* Ability to follow-through and meet deadlines consistently.
* Excellent customer service skills required
* Strong sense of urgency
* Ability to handle multiple routine tasks and requests at once
* Ability to effectively partner with multiple departments throughout the organization
* Ability to maintain confidential information in a professional manner
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio, Adobe Professional

**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree preferred in Information Technology or Information Systems Management. Additional years of relevant experience in lieu of an accredited degree.
* ITIL Foundation certification preferred
* Minimum 5 years plus of demonstrated relevant proficiency, preferable in a fast-paced environment
* Pro-active approach and willingness to accept delegated projects and responsibility
* Experience working for a technology company or department preferred

**Perks & Benefits**

* Remote-First Workplace
* Flexible Fridays
* Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Council
* Monthly Remote Stipend
* Professional Development Stipend (up to $500 annually)
* 1 Wellness/Mental Health Paid Day Off
* 1 Volunteer Paid Day Off
* Health Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision)
* HDHP with HSA plan (annual employer contribution to HSA)
* Employer-Paid Basic Life Insurance and AD&D
* Employer-Paid Short- and Long-term Disability
* Employer-Paid Wellness Reward Program
* Employer-Paid Mental Health Benefit
* Employer-Paid Employee Assistance Program
* Employer-Paid Out of State Medical Travel Benefit
* 401(k) Safe-Harbor Matching
* Ancillary Benefits (pet insurance, legal coverage, identity theft protection, accident, hospital, and critical illness coverages)
* Paid Time Off (increases with tenure)
* Paid Parental, Adoption, and Foster Leave
* Out of State Medical Travel Benefit

\\*This job is not eligible for US visa sponsorship\\*

European Wax Center is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.\\_
